book.title: De iuris arte, methodo, et praeceptis

marginalia.translation:
Grammar. 1. External or by speech. { } Style General or common. { Rhetoric. 2. Form II. { Internal or by reason. { Logic. 3. } Method
Special or particular.{ Nomological or legal. { The law itself, its soul, reason. 4. { that which is to be deliberated. that which is to be settled. 1.2. Lorenzo Valla praises a wonderful style in the preface of the third book of the 'Elegancies'. 3. Pierre Gregoire, Doctor of Canon and Civil Law, examines and discusses the method in chapter two of 'De iuris arte, methodo, et praeceptis', where it is, in general, in this way. Certainly, we can defend in some way the order
in the body of the 'Digest'. But, actually, not by this reasoning, because the 'Arte' is digested. Many things can, and should, be more appropriately positioned than where they are placed, but they are arranged according to the order as it is taught by the [?consareinatores?] of law. Add here the judgement of Dr Thomas Smith in the 'Legal Preface'.
Also Francois Douaren, book one of 'Disputationum anniversariarum libri duo', chapter 55, where he agrees with the order and method of the 'Digest', refuting the innovators, who busy themselves with amending this method.
